Title: Edmonton Parade Route 1982
Summary: ​In June 1982, the city’s first Pride events began. There was no parade, but several small events grouped together to honour the theme “Gay Pride Through Unity” attracted 250 people. These events grew into Gay and Lesbian Awareness Week around 1984. It would be a decade after the raid before the first Pride Protest/Parade would take place, infamously featuring people with bags over their heads to protect their identities. Official support finally arrived in 1993 when Mayor Jan Reimer proclaimed Gay and Lesbian Pride Day

Title: Edmonton Parade Route 1990
Summary: ​During the 1980s, the Gay Lesbian Awareness Society (GALA) organized much of Pride. In 1990, GALA took a huge leap and organized the first Pride parade in Old Strathcona on Whyte Ave.  The first Edmonton Pride was held in Old Strathcona in 1990, met with a rather cold reception. About 75 people marched along two blocks of Whyte Avenue

Title: Edmonton U of A Awareness Week 1990

Title: Edmonton Parade Route 1991
Summary:
​There would not be a pride parade until 1991 and it was not until June 26, 1993 that Edmonton’s Pride Parade was officially recognized by the Mayor and City. City Council had been denying requests from GALA (Gay and Lesbian Awareness Society) since 1984 for recognition.
"[In the first parade] It was about 40 people walking down Whyte Avenue," recalls Michael Phair, "15 of which were wearing bags over their heads."
The small group, some with bags on their heads to conceal their identities, walked without a permit for two blocks on Whyte Ave. from 105 St. to 103 St.

Title: Edmonton Political Events 1991
Summary: ​1991 is also the year Mayor Al Duerr famously proclaims gay pride week in Calgary but then denies future proclamations due to public pressure. The city was in a polarized uproar because Mayor Al Duerr, had gone out on a political limb and signed a proclamation declaring June 16-23, 1991 as the first “Gay Rights Week"

Title: Steinbach Pride Parade 2019
Summary: ​In 2019, the last iteration of the march before public health orders barred mass gatherings to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, nearly 500 residents, business owners and community groups lined the sidewalks and streets to show their support for the LGBTQ2S+ community. Speeches focusing on mental health and wellbeing for marginalized groups were echoed throughout K.R. Barkman Park as part of the festivities.

Title: Pembina Valley Trans Community Event 2016
Summary:
​

My Shoes will be an informative evening about gender and trans experiences. It will begin with a short presentation followed by an information period and a casual Q and A. 

The evening explores gender and the trans experience and is meant to increase visibility for the trans community, raise questions, promote empathy and spark a conversation.

Title: First Flin Flon Pride
Summary: ​There was a flag-raising ceremony and community barbecue on the 18th, followed by the parade and a community fair on the 19th. Around 250 people attended the flag-raising ceremony.

Title: Flin Flon Pride 2018
Summary:
​People were invited to register floats or walking groups for the parade.


According to Flin Flon Pride event organizer, Jordana Oulette, other events featured this year included a second chance prom, a family dance, and a teen movie night. This was also the first year to feature a Trans march

Title: Flin Flon Pride 2019
Summary:
​​The festival included a flag-raising, a trans march, the Pride parade, and a movie night and picnic.


Furthermore, as Jordana Oulette notes, funds were raised to provide secondary school students with a $500  bursary to go toward their post-secondary education. 


On June 24, Flin Flon successfully railed several schools in the area to raise rainbow flags, with some continuing to fly. 


On August 2nd, the first drag show took place after the trout festival crowned one of the competing drag queens as the queen mermaid of the event event.

Title: Flin Flon Pride 2020
Summary: ​The flag-raising ceremony happened at City Hall, with only a hundred people allowed to be present due to provincial health orders during the pandemic. On August 22, Flin Flon Pride hosted "Pride in the Park" at the Rotary Park, which featured a scavenger hunt and other activities for families. The Pride march took place on August 23.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2000
Summary: ​The 2000 theme was “Pride Marches On” which reflected on the achievements gained by the community and acknowledged on the continued struggle for equality and respect.

Title: Winnipeg Parade Route Change 2001
Summary:
Parade Route: From the Legislative Grounds, north on Memorial Boulevard to Portage Avenue, east on Portage to Main Street, south on Main to Broadway, west on Broadway back to the Legislative Grounds and the Festival (free entertainment)


The first annual Pride Walk/Run premiers with proceeds raised for the Village Clinic Emergency Assistance Fund (for Manitobans living with HIV and AIDS).



Michelle Paquette of the Rainbow Resource Centre’s Transgender group becomes the first transgender individual to speak at the Pride Winnipeg rally

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2002
Summary:
​Pride Theme: Pride of the Prairies ​


The Pride Flag is raised for the first time at Winnipeg’s City Hall.


The 2002 Pride Winnipeg Festival saw the introduction of the Pitch for Pride tournament which had over 500 players, volunteers and supporters participate. 


Juno Award winning record artist Carole Pope headlines the 2002 Pride Winnipeg Festival, the first major artist to headline the annual festival. Cope was also selected as the Honourary Grand Marshal for the 2002 Pride Parade.


The 2002 Pride Winnipeg Festival saw a record attendance of 10,000 people participate in the 10-days of celebration, including 3,000 at the June 9th Rally, Parade and Festival.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2003
Summary: ​The 2003 theme “All Together Possible” illuminates some of the core reasons for Pride. Pride is about colourful and exuberant celebration. Pride is about change. Pride is about coming together as a community, showing our support for one another and honouring our achievements. We’ve come a long way and we have proved that achieving our goals is all together possible

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2004
Summary:
​Pride Theme: ​Building Bridges 


The 2004 Pride Winnipeg Festival saw the release of the first edition of the Pride Guide.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2005
Summary: ​The 2005 Theme “I do… “ was in recognition of marriage equality and an expression for the commitment to our culture, history, families, and community

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2006
Summary: ​The 20th Anniversary Theme was “There’s no place like home” which was heart-felt statement for the Winnipeg community to showcase how they are proud of themselves, proud of each other, proud of their community, and proud of Winnipeg

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2007
Summary: ​Pride Theme: Live, Love, Be

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2008
Summary: ​Pride Theme: Stronger Together

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2009
Summary:
​​Pride Theme: Grow with Us


Festival Grows to 10-Days

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2010
Summary:
​Theme for the 2010 Pride Festival is announced as “Proud to Be…” which is a reflection of the diversity in the City of Winnipeg within the GLBTT community.


It is announced that former Winnipeg Mayor Glen Murry will lead the 2010 Pride Parade as the inaugural Grand Marshal.


The outdoor festival moves from Memorial Park to The Forks to accommodate the festivals growth. The move gives more visibility and opportunities for the Pride Winnipeg Festival.


To accommodate the move to The Forks, the Pride Parade route is changed to starting at the Manitoba Legislative Building and going straight down Broadway Boulevard to The Forks.


Queer Beer is launch in partnership with local brewery Half Pints. The “Fruity and Fabulous” beer becomes an annual stable of the Pride Winnipeg Festival

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2011
Summary: The theme for the 2011 Pride Festival is announced as “Unity” which reflect recent events affecting LGBTTQ communities around the world, including the brutal arrest of Moscow Pride organizer Nikolai Alekseev, and a spate of tragic teenage suicides in the U.S. as a result of homophobia-related bullying.

Title: Winnipeg Pride 25th Anniversary Theme
Summary:
​The 25th Anniversary theme “Pride 25” is announced


Pride Winnipeg Festival celebrates 

its 25th Silver anniversary. 

 The Manitoba Legislature is lit up 

in rainbow colours. This is the first time in Canada that a provincial capital building is lit up with the rainbow colours.


The 25th Anniversary gave blossom to many new community events that turned into new annual community events (list community events).

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2013
Summary:
​The 2013 theme “equALL” is revealed. The theme is focused on equality for all.


In an effort to build a presence on YouTube, Pride Winnipeg Festival launches its Out + About YouTube series. The series lasts six episodes and sees a brief resurface in 2016 before ultimately folding.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme/ Festival Expansion 2014
Topics: ["Festival Dates","Pride Theme","Change in Number of Festival Days"]
Summary: ​It is announced that the outdoor festival at The Forks will expand from one to two days. Additionally, the 2014 theme “Without Borders” is revealed. The theme is focused on the issues facing members of the GSRD community globally.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2015
Summary:
​The 2015 theme “Evolution” is revealed. The theme is focused on the evolution of human rights through education, with a primary focus on GSRD rights and freedoms.


Shandi Strong, a trans pioneer, is selected as the Grand Marshal for the 2015 Pride Parade. Maree Rodriguez a youth human rights and mental health advocate is selected as the Youth Marshal. The Manitoba Association for Rights & Liberties was selected as the Community Group Marshal.


Pride Winnipeg receives a Community Leader – Organization award from the Manitoba LGBT* Chamber of Commerce.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2016
Summary:
​The 2016 theme “Be Authentic” is revealed. The theme is focused on encouraging people to be their true, authentic selves every day.


Gayle Pruden, an Ojibwe, Two-Spirit/Trans. Woman from Little Saskatchewan First Nation is selected as the Grand Marshal for the 2016 Pride Parade. Chelsea Hertzog a youth trailblazer and advocate was selected as the Youth Marshal. The Imperial Sovereign Court of Winnipeg, also known as SOMS is selected as the Community Group Marshal.


Gilbert Baker, the creator of the Rainbow Flag is announced as the Inaugural International Marshal for the 2016 Pride Parade. This was the first and only time Pride Winnipeg hosted an International Marshal.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2017
Topics: ["Anniversary Celebration","Parade Marshal","Pride Theme","Parade Route Change","Major Decision/Announcement"]
Summary:
​The 2017 theme “Resurgence: Taking Back Space” is revealed. The theme is focused on the gap between privileged members of the GSRD community and those who continue to face discrimination and social exclusion.


Kelly Houle, a Two-Spirit community activist, is announced as the 2017 Grand Marshal. Mason Godwalt, an 18-year old transgender youth and advocate is selected as the Youth Marshal. Albert McLeod, a long-time indigenous human rights activist and Joel Sarbit an active member of the LGBT community and co-owner of Club 200 are selected at the 30th Anniversary Marshals.


Pride Winnipeg announces that after extensive community consultation the Winnipeg Police Service will be allowed to march in the Pride Parade without their uniforms.

Pride Winnipeg Festival 

celebrated its 30th Anniversary with a return to the Portage Avenue parade route.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2018
Summary:
It is announced that the 2018 theme will be “My First Pride” which aimed at celebrating peoples first Pride experience and for those attending Pride for the first time.


​Brielle Beardy-Linklater a Two-Spirit, Transgender, Queer woman from the Nisichaweyasihk Cree Nation is announced as the Grand Marshal for 2018. Janine Brown, a spoken word poet, is selected as the Youth Marshal. There was no Community Group Marshal for the 2018 Pride Parade

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2019
Summary:
​The 2019 theme “Pride of Colour” is revealed. The theme is focused on the oppression and marginalization experienced by people of colour within GSRD community.


Pride Winnipeg Festival announces it has appointed Muhammad Ahsad as its new President.


The parade route returns to Winnipeg’s famous intersection of Portage Avenue and Main Street for the 2019 Pride Winnipeg Festival.


Pride Winnipeg Festival announces an expansion of its Outdoor Festival and Concert with improvements to its children’s entertainment area, concession villages, and sponsor lounge as well as the addition of a sacred fire at the Oodena Celebration Circle


Peetanacoot Nenakawekapo (Winnie Sunshine), a Two-Spirit person and Trans woman is announced as the 2019 Grand Marshal. The Youth Marshal is Janelle Campagne an LGBTQ* activist and former President of the Collège Louis-Riel GSA group. There was no group marshal for 2019.

Title: Winnipeg Dyke March 2014
Summary:
​Winnipeg Dyke March 2014

Saturday May 31, 2014

River Osborne Community Centre

Park Activities @ 1:00, March to follow

Title: Winnipeg Dyke March 2015
Summary:
​Join us this year to show your dyke and queer pride! We're taking over the streets on Saturday, June 13th! Meet at the River Osborne Community Centre (park behind Wild Planet) and chill out before marching through Osborne Village. This year, DJ Fleur of Queerview will be playing the tunes so GET YOUR DANCE ON!

This is a free, all-ages event. Bring signs, banners, bikes, roller skates, your fur babies (on leashes), and make a lot of noise!

The Dyke March is Winnipeg's annual, women-focused, inclusive celebration of the presence, strength, and solidarity of queers and allies.
We are currently looking for contributors for the second annual WINNIPEG DYKE MARCH ZINE. Our goal is to promote awareness of the personal politics behind the Winnipeg dyke march, we want you - community members to be involved. We are looking for folks to submit articles, poetry, comics, short written word pieces, photos and artwork. Feel free to create anything that you feel relates to your dyke identity, here are some things we would be really love to hear about;
-Safe spaces
-POC experiences and inclusion in the dyke community
-Community organization/uniting community
-Sexual Agency
-Mental health advocacy and experience
-Coming out
-Experiences with accessibility
-Trans inclusion in the dyke community
-Body politics
-Self-care
-Sexuality
We ask that your submissions be made on standard size printer paper (8'X11')
and should either be a 1/2 a page or a full page.
Submissions should be sent to wpgdykemarchzine@gmail.com by Friday May 22nd.
We are excited to hear the voices of our community collaborating on this project!

Title: Winnipeg Dyke March 2016
Summary: ​Inclusive event recognizing marginalized members of community, March through Osborne Village to Memorial Park in downtown Winnipeg. Also celebrated National Day of Action for Sex Workers’ Rights

Title: Winnipeg Dyke March 2011
Summary:
The Winnipeg Dyke March is an annual demonstration of the presence, strength and solidarity of queer women and our allies. 
Our goal is to promote visibility and community.

Saturday, June 4, RAIN OR SHINE, from 2:30 pm to 6:00 pm

Please arrive around 2:00 or 2:30 pm.  
We'll take over the streets at 3:00 pm sharp.
River Osborne Community Centre, 101 Pembina Hwy, through the Village to Memorial Park

Who's Invited?  EVERYONE! 
This is an all-ages, all-abilities and all-genders event. 
You don't need to identify as a dyke or a lesbian to march!

Title: Winnipeg QPOC Ladies Night/Ladies Night Black Party 2019
Summary:
​Annual edition of Ladies Night as a Pride event (happens first Saturday of month year-round). With this year being the 50th Anniversary of the Stonewall Riots, art will be projected throughout the space that pays tribute to the Trans and BIPOC women who have paved the way for our communities. Additionally, there will be a photo booth/selfie wall where participants can capture what Stonewall means to them. 

Opening sets by QPOC resident DJs with featured artist Bambi

2SLGBTTQ*women, non-binary folks, this night is for you

Title: Pride Winnipeg Virtual Event 2020
Summary: ​To ensure that Pride can still be celebrated in 2020, Pride Winnipeg is excited to reveal their plans for a Virtual Pride for September 4th to 13th with more details to follow.

Title: Winnipeg Pride Theme 2021
Summary:
​Theme: Virtual Pride​



Pride week will be scheduled from September 3 to 12, 2021, commencing with the flag raising scheduled for September 3.


Pride Winnipeg has  decided to create this year’s theme around our continuing current reality. So, with this in mind, together let’s celebrate VIRTUAL PRIDE! Pride Winnipeg is pleased to officially kick-off to this year’s events and programming, which will take place between September 3 to 12, 2021.

The 2021 theme, “Virtual Pride,” was decided after long reflection on the continuing global pandemic. We realized that the best way to care for our community and celebrate Pride is embracing the fact that we need to maintain social distance but can still connect with each other through digital platforms. This theme refers not only to how we will deliver our events (virtually), but also how we want to engage and get together with the GSRD (Gender, Social and Relationship Diverse) community.



Major Decision: The PRIDE OF THE PRAIRIES tagline is Pride Winnipeg’s way, in a few succinct words, to tell people who we are and what we stand for. This catchphrase communicates the pride for where we are located – in Canada’s golden Prairies. Pride of the Prairies affirms that we are the heart of Canada, and we’re very proud of celebrating our uniqueness.

Summary: ​Team Registration begins April 15 and closes May 20. Players must be 18+ to play, for insurance and liability purposes. There is no prize money or trophies awarded. Title: Edmonton Colour Yourself Proud 2012
Summary:
​

As we begin our next 30 years, we are looking to increase the scope of our activities in order to provide a non-threatening way for women to meet other women in a comfortable recreational atmosphere. We are excited about being able to utilize the excellent facilities available at HIV Edmonton and will host activities such as potluck suppers, movie night, crib and scrabble tournaments, coffee house/ jam sessions, etc. During this year’s Pride Festival we plan to enter a float in the parade, staff an information booth on Churchill Square and assist at the Pride Family Picnic. We will conclude events with a Pride Dance on June 16 at Hellenic Hall. We look forward to collaborating with our community to make the Edmonton Pride Festival memorable for all! 

 

Everyone is welcome to join us at Hellenic Hall for a colorful way to end pride week. Tickets are $15 for members and $20 for non-members at the door. For more details visit www.womonspace.ca

Title: Edmonton Pride Award 2011
Summary:
​

Pride Awards 

NOMINATE AN INDIVIDUAL FOR A 2011 PRIDE AWARD 

Every year the Edmonton Pride Festival Society rewards outstanding individuals for their contributions to the LGBT community.  

For the named awards, click on the individual's name for a biography about the person the award was named for.  Bios are in both English and French. 

The Award Categories: 

The Michael Phair Award: to an individual gay man for significant contribution to the LGBT community. 

The Maureen Irwin Award: to an individual lesbian woman for significant contribution to the LGBT community. 

The Sheryl McInnis Award: to an individual who, through significant scholarship, teaching and/or academic pursuit has enriched the LGBT community. 

The Larry Sand Award: to a business that has provided significant support and services to the LGBT community. 

The Todd Janes Award: to an individual bisexual man or woman for significant contribution to the LGBT community. 

The Mickey Wilson Award: to an individual trans-identified person for significant contribution to the LGBT community. 

The Outstanding Couple Award:  to a LGBT couple for significant contribution to the LGBT community. 

The HIV Edmonton Youth Leadership Award: for a youth or person who has worked with the LGBT community. Includes a $500 bursery for education. 

Sexual Minorities Community Liaison Committee Award: an award of merit presented to a member of the Edmonton Police Service who has made a significant contribution to the safety, security, and understanding of the LGBTQ community. 

Pride Certificates: for the recognition of an individual, business, or event outside of the above award categories. 

HIV Edmonton is the proud Sponsor of the Pride Awards event

Title: Edmonton Pride Award 2002
Summary:
​

Pride Awards Ceremony 

The Edmonton Pride Awards recognize specific individual or group contributions to the Capital Region's lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered community. Awards are presented annually in the following categories: 

  • The Maureen Irwin Award: to an individual lesbian woman for her long-term contribution to our community at large.  

  • The Michael Phair Award: to an individual gay man for long-term contribution to our community at large. 

  • The Sheryl McInnis Award: to an individual who, through scholarship, teaching, and/or academic pursuit has enriched our community. 

  • The Larry Sand Award: to a business that has solidly supported our community. 

  • Pride Certificates: to recognize individuals, groups, or particular events in the past year. 

  •  

To nominate a person or group, please provide a short bio of the nominee, the reasons you think they deserve the award, and pertinent contact information. 

For more information e-mail Roz Osten at rosten@shaw.ca or Fred Dicker at fdicker@compusmart.ab.ca. 

Send nominations to: 

The Gay & Lesbian Community Centre of EdmontonP.O. BOX 1852MAIN POST OFFICEEDMONTON AB  T5J 2P2 

Or drop the nomination to: 

GLCCE45-9912 99 ST 

The deadline for nominations is May 25, 2002.

Come enjoy a casual, relaxed celebration of Queer pride.

Title: Edmonton Vocal Minority 2008
Summary:
​Edmonton Vocal Minority is excited to be introducing two new choruses to Edmonton's music scene. Yemaya Edmonton Women's Chorus and Edmonton uncomMEN Men's Chorus will make their debut with a concert featuring music for men's, women's, and mixed choruses. 
 
Manwomanthing, a work by Seattle composer David Maddux, lends the concert its title and highlights the cultural differences of Gay men and Lesbian women. Spirituals, World Music, and tunes from recent Broadway hits Avenue Q, The Full Monty, and Dreamgirls are also on the program. 
 
Paula Roberts is conducting the choruses that will be accompanied by local Edmonton musicians. Plan on attending, celebrating Queer Pride, and welcoming the new sounds of Yemaya and uncomMEN! 
 
ASL Interpretation provided. For more information contact EVM at (780)479-2038 or go to www.evmchoir.com.

EVM's 2020 Pride Concert

Title: Edmonton Vocal Minority 2022
Summary:
​Imagine 
 
It has been thirty months, a full two and a half years since EVM has performed in front of live audience, and the choir is excited to reconnect and share its music at its June Pride concert, Imagine, hosted by Darrin Hagen. 
 
After a full season of on-line rehearsing, the choir restarted live rehearsals in September 2021. The singers have adapted to shorter rehearsals, a limited number of singers, and singing while wearing face masks. Their perseverance and dedication have paid off and we invite you to share in EVM’s return to live performances on Saturday, June 4th. 
 
So much has happened in the past two years, and the music for this concert will touch on some of the issues that our society has been facing. We also want to celebrate our resilience and the joy of people coming together supporting one another, offering hope and solace. Since 1993 EVM has been making music and entertaining its audience. Come celebrate with us, we’ve missed you!

Title: Edmonton Laugh Out Proud 2015
Summary:
​

Spend an evening laughing and celebrating with friends AND supporting the Pride Centre of Edmonton! 

This event has grown into an annual favourite at Pride. Tickets are limited so get yours soon. This years line up looks like this! 

MC: Brandon Craig (Calgary) 

Brandon is an excellent comic and a stellar and personable host. He takes comedy very seriously as an art (even though he is a huge goof) and you can see it in his cleverly layered jokes and professionalism. 
This year he was asked to showcase for Mark Breslin, the owner & founder of Yuk Yuk's, to impressive reviews! 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJVWBBZYE1AE9eccXvemaRw 

Middle: Nadine Hunt (Edmonton) 
Though quite new to comedy Nadine has proven her chops by advancing in several contests this year. She is natural on stage and shares candid stories about her life. 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5M3VtZH_75BrG375GKu9hQ 

Headliner: Michael Harrison (Toronto) 
Utilizing an honest, silly and outrageous style, Michael Harrison has been one of the most sought after comedians in Canada. Regularly booking fifty weekends a year, he has proven to be a guaranteed hit! Whether it's a college, corporate, church, comedy club, cruise ship or bar, Michael's diverse act delivers a show that leaves his audiences wanting more. 

In 2011, Michael's comedic talent earned him his own nationally syndicated half-hour comedy special that continues to be aired all over the Comedy Network. In that very same year, he also shot a stand-up spot on the New Years Eve edition of late night show The Being Frank show. 

Besides touring extensively, Michael has also found time to develop a solid acting resume with appearances on Much Music's Video on Trial, NBC's The Bridge, Queer as Folk, the TBS movie The Jazzman and as a co-host on E-West. 

Charming, likeable and laugh out loud funny, Michael Harrison is one act you don't want to miss! 

http://michaelharrisoncomedy.com/ 

See you there! Happy Pride

                 Tickets are available at the University of Alberta Bookstore locations: 
                 UofA Bookstore, Main Campus, 166 Students' Union Building 
                 8900 - 114 Street, 780.492.4215 or toll free @ 1.888.933.9133 
                 Rutherford Corner, Enterprise Square, Suite 1-500 
                 10230 Jasper Avenue, 780.248.1411 
                 Or at: www.bookstore.ualberta.ca 

 

Celebrate the end of Pride Week with Camp fYrefly and the Mayor! 
 
Camp fYrefly is Canada’s only national leadership retreat for sexual minority and gender variant youth. In 2009, Camp fYrefly will open new locations in British Columbia, Saskatchewan, and Newfoundland & Labrador! 
 
Camp fYrefly is the major community service outreach initiative of the Institute for Sexual Minority Studies and Services, University of Alberta. 
 
www.fYrefly.ualberta.ca

Title: Edmonton Mayor's Pride Brunch 2019
Summary:
​The Institute for Sexual Minority Studies and Services presents the 14th annual Mayor’s Pride Brunch on June 16 in support of Camp fYrefly.

Guests will be treated to a delicious brunch with specialty drinks to brighten up their Sunday afternoon. Performances will include an out of this world drag show experience and fun, kid friendly activities for the whole family to enjoy on Father’s Day. All proceeds from the brunch will be used to ensure that no youth is turned away due to the cost of the camp.

Camp fYrefly is an educational, social, and personal learning retreat for sexual and gender minority (LGBTQ2S+) and allied youth. It focuses on building and nurturing their leadership potential and personal resiliency in an effort to help them learn how to make significant contributions to their own lives and to their schools, home/group-home environments, and communities. The Camp is designed for sexual and gender minority and allied youth between the ages of 14 and 24.

The Institute for Sexual Minority Studies and Services (iSMSS) brings together education, research, policy development, and community services in order to ensure that sexual and gender minorities (SGM) recognized and well served by their communities.

Title: Pride Winnipeg Receives Manitoba Human Rights Commitment Award

Title: Winnipeg Attempts to Change Festival Dates
Summary: ​On October 28, 2017, Pride Winnipeg Festival announced that in order to grow the festival a change in the dates was necessary. The community was very unhappy with this decision and a Town Hall meeting was organized on November 22, 2017. During the Town Hall members of the community voiced their concerns with the date change and as a result on December 6, 2017, Pride Winnipeg reversed its decision to change the dates.

Title: Winnipeg Parade Route Changes
Summary: ​A new parade route is announced for the 2018 Pride Parade. The new route is met with disappointment and anger from the community given the previous years route along the major streets of Portage Avenue and Main Street. Community members feel the new route is a step back and is hiding the community away along the backstreets of Downtown Winnipeg. The parade route would return to Portage Avenue the following year.

Title: The Laramine Project
Summary: ​Developed by Moisés Kaufman and the Tectonic Theater Company, this timely play revisits the savage beating of a gay college student in Laramie, Wyoming almost 15 years ago, and examines the community's effort to redefine itself after being labeled intolerant. Presented by the Dept. of Theatre/Film's Acting IV: Honours and senior production students

Title: The Laramie Project
Summary:
​

Performed at the Rachel Browne Theatre

"The Laramie Project" is a play that addresses the murder of openly gay Matthew Shepard, a young twenty-one-year-old man. This documentary-style play takes place in the small town of Laramie, Wyoming, where the hate crime that took the life of Matthew Shepard sparked national debate exactly 20 years ago. We had overwhelming support from the community and we sold out all three of our performances. Due to all of our support, we were able to donate the proceeds of our show to The Matthew Shepard Foundation and The Rainbow Resource Centre's youth programming (both Peer Project and BLiNK). Half of the proceeds were given to The Matthew Shepard Foundation while the other half were split evenly between our local Rainbow Resource Centre's youth programs. Our production of “The Laramie Project” was voted the “Favourite Local Performance of 2018” by The Uniter Journal.

Summary: ​Rainbow Resource Centre's Youth Program, QPOC Winnipeg, and Queerview present...PRIDE YOUTH DANCE PARTY! Featuring: * DJ Kilusan from QPOC Winnipeg! * Drag performances by Dirt, Supernova, Sonny Dee, Lady Quinnzarr, and SlayTana! * A talent show put on by youth! * Pride photo backdrop! Bring your own phones/cameras! * A quiet space available to make art! * Snacks! Please note: * WECC is wheelchair accessible (elevator on site) * There will be loud music and dim lighting * Gender-inclusive washrooms* It is important to us that the event is a positive space for everyone in the community to attend, we will not tolerate... * verbal, emotional, physical, or sexual harassment of any kind; * racist, sexist, classist, homophobic, transphobic, fatphobic, ableist, xenophobic, or any other oppressive behaviors or language

Title: REEL Pride Film Screening 2020
Summary:
​

Reel Pride Film Festival is proud to announce that this year's festival will take place Tuesday October 13th to Sunday October 18th! This year will be the 35th anniversary of the founding of the festival; making it one of the oldest continuously incorporated LGBTTQ+ film societies. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic we are planning an online Film Festival with lots of exciting additions! 

The Reel Pride Film Festival: Celebrates queer media arts and contributes to societal vitality through programming focused on diversity, race, culture, religion, class, gender, ability, health and age. Promotes dialogue in a public, accessible and safe environment where artists and their stories bring awareness and understanding on issues from around the world. Supports unique opportunities to engage artistic work from

beyond Manitoba and provide a global of experience of human rights and liberties. · Elevates Manitoba's rich diversity by increasing awareness and understanding of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, two-spirit, queer communities

Title: Edmonton Read and Write with Pride 2015
Summary:
​Read and write with pride! Join Audreys books and 7 local LGBT writers on June 9th at 7pm for an evening of storytelling, memoir, and poetry. Authors Rob Browatzke, Alex Powell, Heidi Belleau, and Sheldon L’Henaff will read aloud excerpts of their fiction featuring gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender characters: stories of romance, sex, kidnapping, and coming of age that will take you from Wonderland to the battlefields of WWII, from the halls of a high school in Saskatchewan to a glitzy Vancouver art gallery. Marc Colbourne will share the gripping true story of Arsham Parsi, an Iranian queer activist who came to Canada to escape persecution, and poets Marina Reid Hale and Laurie Macfayden will delight you with their personal, political, and always engrossing verse.
After the reading, the panel as well as Audreys’ knowledgable staff will be on hand to answer all your questions about LGBT lit, whether you’re looking for more to read or interested in creating or publishing your own works. With more ways than ever to share our stories, reading and writing with pride has never been more achievable . . . or enjoyable!
Author signing and light refreshments to follow. This event is free to attend!

Title: Flin Flon Pride Formed
Summary: ​Flin Flon Pride is officially formed, later marches in the Canada Day celebrations.
Source Link:
Information provided by member of Flin Flon Pride, Jordana Oulette
https://canandapridehistory.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/CanadianPrideHistoricalSociety/ERXM2zLwHGRAp6st_ecWKKUBU0M32kGr2LxAoV2hQ4FBFw?e=0kWhPb

Title: Flin Flon Pride 2021
Summary: ​Unlike 2020, most of Flin Flon's events were virtual for 2021. The flag raising and parade were both streamed to audiences at home. Luckily, because Flin Flon borders Saskatchewan (who had recently shifted public health orders) drag performances were, ultimately, able to take place with a live audience. Furthermore, Jordana Oulette, who has been with Flin Flon Pride from the beginning also describes taking over the  radio and having people perform the same song and  later splicing them all together in creative, often clever ways. Overall, Jordana describes Flin Flon as "small but mighty."
Source Link:
Information obtained from interview with Jordana Oulette of Flin Flon Pride
https://canandapridehistory.sharepoint.com/:w:/s/CanadianPrideHistoricalSociety/ERXM2zLwHGRAp6st_ecWKKUBU0M32kGr2LxAoV2hQ4FBFw?e=0kWhPb

Title: Pride North of 55 Mini Festival
Summary: ​On June 28th Pride North of 55 will host a daytime mini festival followed by a nighttime social event. Beyond giving members of the LGBTTQ community a space within the small community to celebrate it also provides members of the Thompson (and surrounding communities) community who are not part of the LGBTTQ community to demonstrate their acceptance of sexual diversity.

Title: Thompson Celebration of 2Spirit and Indigiqueer People 2021
Summary: ​Event Details: Get your beading & bannock and come sit by the fire with Harlie and other 2Spirit and Indigiqueer people of Turtle Island! We will talk about some of the great 2Spirit people in history, our roles both traditional and contemporary, and how we can create a safer community for 2Spirit and Indigiqueer people in the North. This is a free event on Zoom, to register email pridenorthof55@gmail.com or message our Facebook page

Title: LGBT* & Allies Sweat Lodge
Summary: ​Pride North of 55 and MKO are proud to bring a traditional Sweat. A sweat is a typical ceremony that occurs before and after a special ritual. The aim of the ceremony is to purify one's mind, body, spirit and heart. Sweats are commonly used in the aboriginal culture to cleanse, release anger, guilt and shame in a safe way, and to bring people together as ONE. Come out and join us for a one of a kind experience and embrace the ways of aboriginal culture. Just a reminder there will be no photography allowed at this event.

Reservation Required. Community Wise Resource

Title: Calgary Gay History Tour - Downtown 2015
Summary: Downtown Gay history Walking Tour. Join the Calgary Gay History Project’s Kevin Allen on a walk through the city centre. We will highlight significant political and social events that affected the gay community. On the way we will pass by several historical watering holes where gays and lesbians gathered. Everyone welcome. Reservation Required. Community Wise Resource

Title: Calgary Homo Hop 2015
Summary: A family friendly all ages dance! Come out and kick off your pride weekend with all your friends and family! Location: Loft 112

Title: Brunch for Camp fYrefly 2015
Summary:
Premier’s Pride Brunch
In support of Camp fYrefly Join us for our annual Premier’s Pride Brunch celebration in support of CampfYrefly – Canada’s only national leadership retreat for sexual and gender minority youth! Help our youth celebrate pride by donating a ticket for one or more youth to attend! All ages welcome.
 Location: Hyatt Regency Hotel

Title: Calgary PURE Pride Dance 2015
Summary:
The most anticipated event of the year in Calgary is finally here!! Celebrating 10 years of pride events in Alberta we are excited to announce our pride tradition with the biggest stars and the hottest Pure Pride line-up ever!!!!!
The show is starring one of the most popular pop stars of this decade DEV!!
DEV is a multi million selling artist with number one hits backing this powerful pop-star such as Dancing in the Dark, Like a G-6 and who could forget the mega hit Bass Down Low! DEV is young, energetic and she has been viewed on YouTube over 200 million times.
DEV is live in concert at Pure Pride Calgary, we are so proud she is joining us for our 10th anniversary finale at the main event and official party of Pride Calgary 2015!!!
Also performing is Rupauls Drag Race favourite and season 7 finalist, Pearl performing live and doing a meet and greet with the other stars in the VIP balcony!
It doesn’t stop there, The most famous pornstar in the world/ movie star, with millions of fans worldwide and many feature film credits we are proud to present Brent Corrigan, who will be performing on stage and also mingling with our VIP guests on the VIP balcony getting to know you personally !
The night will be filled with incredible ambient performers including stunning performances from former Cirque Du Soleil performer Tyler Ayres, bringing his sexy art to the Pure Pride stage.
Alberta has some of the finest performers in the world and we are very proud to showcase the amazing talents of DJ Dopamine, Cary York Jones, April Storm, Devery Bess, Argintina, Farah Moan, Ruby Hymen, Elektra Kute, The Snap Boys, Angelina Starchild, the amazing Pure Pride Boys and more!!!
This Pride party promises to be the best party of any pride party in Canada this year and expect to see guests from all over North America.
Enhance your pride experience on the VIP balcony where you will get a chance to meet all 3 mega stars and participate on our VIP photo booth and take selfies and experience this once in a lifetime all star cast at our 10th anniversary finale.
This party has sold out every year so get your tickets while you can.
Happy 2015 Pride and 10 years of Pure Pride!
 Location: Flames Central
(219 8th Ave SW
Calgary, Alberta Canada)

Organization Name: ["Fairy Tales Presentation Society, Calgary Underground Film Festival & Hole In The Wall Studios"]

Calgary Underground Film Festival has partnered with Fairy Tales and Hole in the Wall Studios for a celebration of the 40th Anniversary of THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW during Pride Week.
Live preshow hosted by Phil featuring performances from Fake Mustache and RHaPSody. Costumes and full audience participation encouraged.

(617 8 Ave SW)

Summary: Walking tour through the university campus, exploring the institution’s role in speaking gay liberation movement in Calgary. Everyone welcome. Q Centre, MacEwan Hall

Title: Calgary PURE Pride Dance 2017
Summary:
The big party is starring the one and only Sasha Velour, winner of the hit TV show, Rupauls Dragrace plus runner up of season 9 the amazing Shea Coulee!!!
If that isn’t enough to knock your socks off the Pure Pride boys will hit the stage to get you dancing lead by the sexy Brent Everett.
There will be an exclusive VIP reception at 9 PM for VIP ticket holders including:
– VIP Meet and Greet with Sasja and Shea
– VIP photobooth of the meet and greet
– Souvenier VIP laminate
– VIP access to the VIP balcony to see the show
-VIP only Balcony bar
During the VIP reception there will be showcase performances from some of the best performers in the country including :
April Storm, Kendall Gender, Farah Moan, Argintina, Man UP, Evan Westfal, Smother Theresa, Elektra Kute, Ella Vathyme, Donna Mae Trixx, Misty Meadows, Valentina, Quannah Style, Andra Jini!.
Once the VIP reception is done you will hit the dance floor with the best gay anthems and popular dance remixes by Vancouver’s Nick Bertossi, DJ Rsquared vs Reid Bourgois and Nic Nemesis
This party has sold out the last 5 years in a row so make sure you get your tickets!! Happy Pride!!!

Summary: Step right up and join the Calgary Men's Chorus for this family-friendly sing-along movie extravaganza! Tickets are available at the door by donation to the CMC – first come, first served. Circus attire is encouraged! Globe Cinema

Organization Name: ["Calgary Underground Film Festival, Calgary Queer Arts Society & Hole in the Wall Studios"]
Summary:
The Calgary Underground Film Festival, Calgary Queer Arts Society and Hole in the Wall Studios present the Rocky Horror Picture Show as part of the Calgary Pride. A classic film event made even more fun with our unique presentation! The live pre-show features performances by Phil, Fake Mustache and Clint Torres. Title: Calgary Service for Gay Pride 2019
Summary: Join the Affirming Network of Faith Communities in Calgary for their City Wide Pride Service. Held at Knox United Church on September 1 at 9:00am, this will be an inclusive service – if you’ve never been to a church service, or it’s been a long time since you’ve been to a service, this is a space for you. Featuring guest speakers Pam Rocker and Stephane Youdom with a solo performed by Chantal Stormsong Changnon, the service will be finished in time for everyone to find a good spot for the parade and to get their floats in time!

Title: Bow Valley Christmas Celebration 2012
Summary:
Bow Valley Care Centre hosts a wine and cheese event for residents of Banff. The event is held at Wild Flour Bakery on December 20 from 6-9p.m. It is OUTHere's first holiday gathering.

 

OUTHere Bow Valley - Banff, Canmore, Lake Louise, Kananaskis was formed in June 2012 as a support group for the LGBTQ community in the area, organising events and social activities. In 2012 they held a barbecue and a trip to Lake O'Hara. The group lasted until 2019.

As the group started growing, its attendees wanted more of a community presence, so a task force was created. Eventually Banff Pride was formed, and the dream of having their small event grow year after year was realised.

Title: First Banff Pride Celebration
Summary:
Banff's first Pride celebration was held at Wild Bill's Saloon in Banff. The event was presented by OUTHere Bow Valley – Banff, Canmore, Lake Louise, Kananaskis. With a 5$ cover, the 5-hour event featured performances by Banff Drag Academy, featuring Miss Ellen Q (a.k.a. Jeff Bembridge), Isolde N. Barron, Peach Cobblah.
Also in town that night was Serena Ryder, who was performing at a separate venue. The Drag Academy based one of their sets on her music. People attended from Jasper, Invermere, Calgary, Edmonton and British Columbia.

Title: Banff Rainbow Flag Request Denied 2014
Summary: Joe Bembridge asked for a rainbow flag to be flown, but municipal flag protocols don't allow for other flags to be flown at town hall.

Title: Banff Pride 2014
Summary: One more event was added to the celebrations this year. Avant Ski, a party and fashion show, was held on Friday Oct 24 at Aurora Nightclub. Pride 2014 held its weekend celebration at Wild Bill's Legendary Saloon from 9p.m. - 2a.m. It was organised by Miss Ellen Q. This weekend event caps off Pride Week.

Title: Banff Pride Facebook Debut
Summary: August 28, 2014 Banff Pride creates Facebook page

Title: Banff Rainbow Sidewalk Meeting with City Council 2015
Summary:
Joe Bembridge, Banff Pride organiser and producer, went to Banff City Council to request a rainbow crosswalk be painted. His original suggestion was for the scramble crosswalk at Banff Avenue and Caribou Street to be painted. Because this would be too expensive, the council suggested one crosswalk be pointed, with Banff Pride supplying paint and the city covering labour cost.

The motion was put forward by Mayor Karen Sorensen, who has been a keen supporter of Banff Pride since the beginning. [10]

in the end, Best of Banff, https://www.banfflodgingco.com/ (Banff Lodging Co.) sponsors a crosswalk for Banff Pride. In the end, BanffLife sponsors the crosswalk.

Title: Banff Pre-Pride Preparations 2015
Summary: Banff Pride starts gearing up for Oct 3/15 Pride by presenting “To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything” in August. They partnered with BanffLife, a youth and young adults community centre.

Title: Banff Partnership 2015
Summary: BanffLife, youth and young adults' community centre, held a Pasta Night every Wednesday in October for Pride, featuring rainbow pasta.

Title: Banff Pride 2015
Summary:
October 3, 2015 Banff Pride at Wild Bill's Saloon, featuring:

Miss Ellen Q

Visa de'Klein

Chi Chi & Argintina Hailey (2 spirit member of Stony Nakoda Nation)

Title: Banff Pride Award 2015
Summary: Banff Pride's Kim Mayberry was celebrated with 9 others, receiving a SHINE (SHARE, HELP, INSPIRE, NURTURE & ENRICH) award for her community service.

Title: Banff Pride Canda Day Parade 2016
Summary:
Banff Pride has a float in the Canada Day parade.
The float's theme is “Love is Love”. The community was invited to be part of the float, dressing as fairies, angels or cupids.

Title: Banff Rainbow Crosswalk 2016
Summary: Banff Lodging Company again sponsored cross walk

Title: Banff Pride Week 2016
Summary:
Pride 2016 saw an increase in events.

Friday 30 September: There was a short march from the Banff Ave crosswalk to Banff Community High School for a flag-raising.

Saturday 1 October: Family Pride Pizza Party, Bison Courtyard, bakery on Bear Street, with games sponsored by Alberta Teachers Association Local 59 & Arctos & Bird

Saturday 1 October: 1:30- 2:30 p.m. Pride dance class by Joe and Melissa at Dance for Joy Studio for high school students: by donation to Camp Fyrefly.

Saturday 1 October: Annual Pride celebration, the “one and only drag show” at Wild Bill's Saloon. Tickets were 20$, 25$ at the door.

The pride events were listed as part of Alberta Culture Days

Title: Banff Pride Canada Day Parade 2017
Summary:
Once again, Pride Banff is participating in the Canada Day parade.

The theme is “Red, White & Rainbow”. Community is invited to participate.

Title: Banff Pride Leadership Change 2017
Summary: Banff Pride 2017, held on Oct 14, will be the last one that Joe Bembridge will be organising. His move out of Banff will end his partnership with Banff Pride. Banff Pride will travel a new path.

Title: Banff Pride Restructure 2018
Summary:
Part of the restructuring of Banff Pride is looking at partnering with other Pride organisations such as Bow Valley Pride, and looking at how to connect with LGBTQ2 community members in areas that are more isolated across the valley.

 
The meeting, entitled “Let's Talk About Pride” was held on

Saturday 6 June. The Banff community was invited, as Banff Pride would like them to be more involved in planning the celebrations and in advocacy.[12]

Title: Banff Rainbow Crosswalk 2018
Summary: The Rainbow crosswalk is now a permanent feature at the pedestrian bridge.

Title: Banff Canada Day Parade 2018
Summary: Theme: Red, White and Rainbow.

October 9: first Rainbow Walk from Caribou/Bear Streets to Banff Community Hight School/ for flag-raising at the high school.
Oct 10: Rainbow Pasta Night with Banff Life

children's Arts and Crafts
dance class for kids with Dance for Joy Studio, Banff
Also on Oct 13:
Rainbow Walk. With ceremony by Rainbow Alliance with   Eldre Fox, Cam Westhead (MLA for Banff-Cochrane), Mayor Sorensen
Hike  - Sulphur Mountain
Oct 13 events mark official end to Banff Pride Week 2018. Events were held all week; the first time Banff Pride has done this.
Oct 14: Pride After party at Devil's Gap Bar with DJ Palf.

Summary:
Oct 1: Rainbow Walk and Flag Raising. 20 people went

Oct 2: Rainbow Reels, at Lux Cinema, with donations to Banff Pride. Event presented by Banff Centre for Arts and Creativity, Banff Pride, the Lux Cinema. Films presented celebrated queer womxn

Oct 6: Pride in the Park, with live music, mini pride parade, food, crafts, facepainting and drag storytelling
Sun Oct 6: Pride Run, presented by lululemon Banff X Run Uphill
Sun Oct 6: Pride Week after Party

Attendance: “In 2019, that event that we did hold sold out, had 500 people, but now, we have a weeklong worth of events that are selling out,” Carpenter said. (Likely about the party at Wild Bill’s)

Title: Banff Pride Week 2020
Summary:
Pride this year was affected by Covid-19. It was not cancelled, but was reworked to ensure the safety of patrons.

Covid Protocol for events included:

 

marching with masks

social distancing

holding events outside

Many events were done via Zoom. The Pride Party at Wild Bill's was cancelled this year. Banff Pride also had its own masks made by Canmore Mask Makers (a community group) and Defending Awesome, with proceeds going to Banff Pride

A rainbow path was permanently painted on the Banff pedestrian bridge. The Rainbow Walk now starts here. NDP Leader Rachel Notley walked new rainbow path

 

Sun Oct 4: Affirming Celebration. Via Zoom and presented by Rundle United church, which has been an ally of Banff Pride.

Sun Oct 4: Pride Trivia Night, Banff Springs Hotel

Sun Oct 4: Chalk-full of Pride at Whyte Museum

Mon Oct 5: Rainbow Walk from Pedestrian Bridge to Banff Community High School for flag raising.

Tues Oct 6: Pride community Classes, including Banff Yoga Practice

Tues Oct 6: Pride Cask Night, Banff Ave Brewing Co.

Wed Oct 7: Inqueering Minds Open Mic Night at The Radiant

Wed Oct 7: Pride Movie Night at the Lux, showing Rocky Horror

Thu Oct 8: Drag Comedy Night at The Radiant

Fri Oct 9: Pride Paint Night

Sat Oct 10: Drag Storytelling and Children's Tea, with Felice Bonee, Penny Tense, all in support of Banff Library's collection of inclusive literature

Sat Oct 10: Drag Brunch: Celebration of Love

Title: Banff Unique Partnerships 2020
Summary: Restaurants and bakeries around town participated in Taste the Rainbow. Customers can purchase special sweets from around town to support Pride.

Summary:
Oct 2 – Pride Kick-off Party with Brooke Lynn Hytes
Sat Oct 3: Chalk-full of Pride

Oct 4: Rainbow Walk: About 40 people attended and Mayor Karen Sorensen, who is indigenous, gave welcoming prayer

Sat Oct 9: Mountain Top Drag Show, on top of Banff Gondola. This event was held because the annual event at Wild Bill's was cancelled due to Covid.
Oct 10: Intro to Rock Climbing

Oct 10: The Corey Hotline. Pride Closing. The Corey Hotline is a Garage/Party rock trio from Calgary. Lead vocalist (Mason Jenkins) being a trans-gendered person, a lot of their music surrounds his struggles, history and love for Calgary.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride 2018
Summary: PRIDE YMM Celebrations are back from 12:00-4:00pm at Jubilee Plaza and McMurray Experience on Aug 18th Performances, music, art, swag giveaways and activities will take place throughout the day along with drag story time, face painting, and crafts for the kids. This is a family friendly event! Blue Mountain Bistro is cooking up a BBQ lunch for purchase as well as a featured Pride menu inside their location. Drinks are also available at the Bistro. Come out and show your pride at the second annual pride celebration!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Day Proclaimed 2018
Summary: Pride Day proclaimed by Don Scott Mayor of the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo in Fort McMurray, Alberta

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Young Peoples' LGBTQ Focus Group
Summary: Let your voice be heard! Fort McMurray Boys & Girls Club is partnering with Pride YMM to hold an LGBTQ Focus Group! This is focus group is meant to bring all LGBTQ youth and supporters together to discuss one important topic: How to Engage and Educate our community. The first meeting will be filled with planning, discussion, introductions and building the foundation for the group. Focus group members will be able to meet the AB Minister in September to truly get their voice heard! We welcome all LGBTQ youth, GSA members, and supporters to join. For more information, please email

Title: Yuk Yuk's Comedy Show Pride YMM Fundraiser
Summary: Yuk Yuk's On Tour Comedy Show Fundraiser for Pride YMM May 31st, 2019 | Doors at 7:00 PM | Show at 8:00 PM Hosted by Cindy Hann featuring Chris Gordon and Malik Elassal.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Stonewall 50th Anniversary Drag Show Fundraiser
Summary: The Oil Royals are pleased to present a night of music, drag, comedy and more. We will be remembering and celebrating the past 50 years of the LGBTQ+ rights movement. Hosted by Simma Downe and Billi Gold Comedy by Cindy Rivers-Hann Drag by Stella L’Amour, Ella Lamoureux, D’White Beets and a new king! With DJ Q-Pid and much more! Proceeds will be going towards Pride YMM. this is an 18+ event.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Week Opening Ceremonies 2019
Summary: Kicking off the week with a ceremony at Municipal Jubilee Building!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Unapologetically You: Accepting & Expressing Your Authentic Self
Summary: Join Brooke and Pattie for an unforgettable gathering where you will dive deep into self-reflection, self acceptance, and community. They will guide you through an all-levels yoga practice, meditation on self-acceptance, and community discussion. No experience is necessary. Please bring a yoga mat if possible. If you need to borrow a mat please let us know as we have extras we can bring. Everyone is welcome! $15 Donation Recommended.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Craft Night 2019
Summary: Celebrate YMM Pride by getting crafty! We’re making rainbow dreamcatchers. All supplies will be provided (16+). There is no cost. Registration opens at 9am on July 19 at the link provided.

Title: PRIDE YMM Free Rainbow Stencil Canvas Workshop 2019
Summary: This is free workshop we will be hosting in celebration of Pride week 2019! Come create a special pride themed rainbow canvas. Registration in advance is required as spots are limited. Call or message us to reserve a spot!

Title: Pride is a Riot (literally): A Community Conversation
Summary: The first Pride was a riot, a protest against hate and prejudice. While improvements in equity have been made, there remains widespread discrimination against the LGBTQ2S+ community. We invite you to take part in a community conversation exploring our experiences and our path forward in healing and fostering a more inclusive community for all. Free event. Sensitive content. Meals and refreshments will be provided.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Amateur Stand Up Comedy Night 2019
Summary: ****PRIDE Addition! Our comedy scene in Fort McMurray is very welcoming and inclusive. We are very excited to be part of this years Pride Week**** Do you want to discover the excitement of stand up comedy? Well come to Bailey’s Pub this Tuesday and sign up for our Amateur night. Just want to watch? Great! Grab a friend and come support some local talent. 10 X 5 minutes spots per night Sign up is from 8:30pm-9pm Show is from 9pm – 10pm/10:30pm

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Movie Night 2019
Summary: Celebrate YMM Pride with a movie night at the library featuring movies with empowering messages about acceptance, being true to yourself, and love! We’ll provide the snacks.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Board Game Night with PRIDE 2019
Summary: Mr.E's Solve-It-Torium presents a night of fun and family friendly BOARD GAMES! Come by to TACTICAL MAGIC GAMES (in Thickwood), and we will have tables and games set up. Come as you are, or dress up! We will have snacks and drinks by donation for PRIDE YMM! We will also have a few door prizes for all those who attend! Feel free to bring your own games or try some we have provided!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Beers for Queers 2019
Summary: Beers for Queers at Bailey's Pub Fort McMurray on August 22nd! Continue the Pride week celebration with drink specials and karaoke! Everyone welcome!

Title: Robbie Picard Media Presents DJ Sumation & PRIDE YMM PreParty 2019
Summary: Last year Robbie Picard Media turned Sociables into a PRIDE Bar. It was an amazing time where people from all walks of life and ages felt comfortable in a safe and fabulous environment. Please join us as we celebrate our diversity and what brings us together with DJ Sumation from Toronto.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Yoga in the Park 2019
Summary: Pride, stretch repeat. Start your day off right with yoga in the park! Join Brooke for a yoga class where every body is welcome. All levels class. Please bring your own yoga mat. Free event.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Celebration 2019
Summary: Pride YMM is pleased to present the third annual Pride Celebration 2019. This is a family friendly event that is open for anyone to attend. Live music, performances, activities, games, and delicious food will bring together people of all ages, gender identities, gender expressions, and sexual orientations to celebrate Pride in our community.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride After Party 2019
Summary: The Oil Royals are so excited to bring back the 3rd annual Pride After Party. With special guest Farrah Nuff! Hosted by Simma Downe and Ella Lamoureux. Performances by Billi Gold, Stella L'Amour and Eric Nochurch! DJ Q-Pid will be keeping the party going all night long! 18+ event

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Qmmunity Picnic 2019
Summary: Finish Pride Week with a relaxing picnic with family and friends, games, volleyball, or a float on the river. Grab your picnic basket packed with snacks and join us for a relaxing end to the week.

Title: Pride YMM Celebration 2019
Summary: LOVE DOESN'T NEED A CURE Come celebrate with Pride YMM at Bailey's Pub Fort McMurray after the council meeting on Tuesday, October 22nd at 8pm. Unlimited chicken wings for $9.99!

Title: Pride YMM Leadership Awards 2020
Summary: Celebrate the leaders in our community with the 3rd Annual Pride YMM Leadership Awards presented by RBC, hosted by Simma Downe.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Video 2020
Summary: Covid-19 Pride Video

Title: Pride YMM Community Vigil Live Stream 2020
Summary: Join Pride YMM live on Facebook as we remember and celebrate all the people who have been lost due to homophobia and transphobia. We will remember all those that died fighting for LGBTQ+ Rights, and all those we lost to the AIDS crisis. This is an event to bring our community together to remember everyone we've lost.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Community Rainbow Space Training
Summary: Join Pride YMM Facilitators for an interactive and informative virtual workshop focused on LGBTQ2+ Inclusivity and empowering Allies!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Week 2021
Summary: 2021 Pride Week schedule

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Lip Sync Battle 2021
Summary: The Oil Royals are hosting a Lip Sync Battle. With esteemed drag judges, hilarious antics are bound to ensue.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Opening Ceremony 2021
Summary: Join the Pride YMM board and dignitaries for the official flag raising and kick off to the 2021 Pride Week

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Femme Night/Queer Fame 2021
Summary: The Oil Royals are hosting a femme night with drag, burlesque and dancing. This event is for all ladies, and queer femmes, to mix and mingle with great entertainment.

Title: Pride YMM: Zentangle Rainbows 2021
Summary: Let's celebrate Pride in YMM with zentangle rainbow art with watercolour paints and ink. This program is for tweens (9-12yrs) and will take place in the Syncrude Program Room.

Title: Pride YMM: Rainbow Sky Paint Day 2021
Summary: Celebrate Pride in YMM with us as we create a beautiful rainbow sky painting. This program is for teens & adults (13+) and will take place in person in the Syncrude Program Room.

Title: Two Spirit Tea - Live at Fort Mac Pride 2021
Summary: Ella and Simma will be talking about their favourite Pride events and memories as they prepare for Fort McMurray Pride. Tune in for Episode 12, LIVE Tuesday, August 31st, 2021 @ 6:30 PM (PST) on Unicorns.LIVE!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Karaoke/Drag Karaoke 2021
Summary: Simma Downe and Billi Gold will be hosting a fun karaoke night.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Bingo 2021
Summary: When Drag meets Bingo you better believe you're in for a good time. Come out for a fun evening of dabbing those dabbers, and winning some fabulous prizes. Tickets include your bingo cards and a bingo dabber.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Queen Paint Night 2021
Summary: Paint some Rainbow Lips with Simma Downe. Guaranteed fun for everyone!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Me to Brunch 2021
Summary: Enjoy a full brunch buffet while you see the talented line up of drag performers.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Yoga 2021
Summary: Celebrate all the colours of the rainbow at PRIDE YOGA! A "Pay What You Can" class at Exhale Yoga & Barre, with proceeds going toward Pride YMM to help support their initiatives for the LGBTQ2S+ community here in Fort McMurray. This is a beginner-friendly yoga practice for everyone who wants to celebrate Pride Week. We believe that yoga is for everybody and every BODY, regardless of ethnicity, age, shape, size or ability. Regardless of gender or sexual orientation. This will be a special class inclusive to everyone; Yoga for all!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo The Roast of Simma Downe 2021
Summary: Fort McMurray's own Drag Super Star Simma Downe is stepping into the hot seat. Come out for a fabulous night of glam, trash talking, zingers, insults, burns, and whatever else our larger then life panel of Kings, Queens, Fairies, and comedians decides to throw at each other at this classic roast style event.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Festival/Pride YMM Festival 2021
Summary: Come celebrate Pride at Shell Place with a variety of entertainment and games. Fun for all ages!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo The Pride After Party 2021
Summary: The Pride After Party is Fort McMurray's biggest drag show and queer party of the year!

Title: Pride YMM Family Fun Fair 2022
Summary: Pride YMM is hosting a Family Fun Fair. There will be face painting, games, crafts, snacks, prizes and more! There is fun for the whole family! Admission is free. Purchase games tickets for $2 (games will be 1-2 tickets each). We will also have a donation bin to collect nonperishable food items and toiletries for the United 4 Revolution Mutual Aid Fund for those who wish to donate.

Title: McMurray Metis Youth Group Pride BBQ 2022
Summary: McMurray Metis Youth Group Pride BBQ.  Open for members ages 12-29!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Queer Prom 2022
Summary: Queer Prom is a safe space for all 2SLGBTQ+ youth and allies. This is an opportunity to celebrate all the proms that have been missed over the last couple years. To celebrate without heternormative expectations, openly and freely as your truest self. There will be pop-up drag performances, from Billi Gold, Stella L'Amour, Ella Lamoureux and Toddy! There will be a candy bar and refreshments. A special DJ - Simma Downe! Ages 14-19 is a general guide and exceptions can be made by request.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo That's So Gay Comedy Night 2022
Summary: Get prepared to be hit with a RAINBOW of jokes! The line up for this night of comedy is one you don't want to miss. Featuring local underage power house Laurel Spring. That's right, you read correctly, she's underaged. Meaning we only let her in the bar for the jokes and then she has to leave (no matter how funny she is). The man, the myth, the legend himself, Michael Jesso. See him well you can before Hollywood gets wind of how talented he is with a stage and a mic and we can no longer afford tickets to his show. Hosted by mega flirt Erica Moeskau (seriously no one is safe from her advances) and Starring extra special guest, winner of season one's Call Me Mother - Toddy! IF you have ever attended a comedy show and thought "wow what a straight line up", we promise you will NOT be thinking that at this show. Come feel seen. Come learn something new. Come out to be an ally. Just get your butt out for a night of laughs in honour of Pride 2022

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Story Time at the End of the Rainbow 2022
Summary: Join special guest, Simma Downe for the return of our LGBTQ+ story time program. In partnership with Pride YMM. (Part of a year round program.)

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Me To Brunch Pride Edition 2022
Summary: There is no better way to officially kick off Pride Week than with Drag Brunch! Performances from Stella L'Amour, Billi Gold, Simma Downe and from the TV Show Call Me Mother, Ella Lamoureux and Toddy! Tickets include a buffet brunch, a mimosa and of course the best drag show in town!

Title: Tweens Crafting - Pride Perler Beads/Pride YMM: Pride Perler Beads 2022
Summary: Tweens are invited to celebrate pride by making rainbow perler bead creations. Pins, badges, coasters - the sky is the limit! (9-12yrs)

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Empty Bowls Painting 2022
Summary: Join Simma Downe to Paint Empty Bowls for the Wood Buffalo Food Bank Empty Bowls Festival.

Title: Cherry Pop Drag Show 2022
Summary: Cherry Pop is a stage for those looking to dip their toes in the world of drag. You have the option to be paired with one of our mentors who will assist you in making your debut. The audience will be in for a treat with a mix of new raw talent and a stunning cast of experienced mentors. Featuring Ella Lamoureux, Eric NoChurch, Billi Gold, Simma Downe and Toddy! To apply to perform fill out the attached forma and we will be in touch.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Opening Ceremonies 2022
Summary: Kickoff Pride Week with the opening ceremonies and Flag Raising. Speeches from Pride and delegates.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Rainbow STEAM Lab 2022
Summary: What's in a rainbow? Kids are invited to celebrate pride by learning all about rainbow science! (6-8yrs)

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Coffee Social 2022
Summary: The Coffee Social is a low pressure environment to connect with some delicious coffee and treats.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Self Defense Class 2022
Summary: A special 2SLGBTQ+ friendly self defense class for all abilities.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Barre & Burlesque 2022
Summary: Join Amanda for a night of sassy, flirty fun and learn how to put a little va-va-va in your voom! In this 90 minute fun-filled workshop, we'll start with a sultry barre workout and then we'll learn a vivacious hip-bumping burlesque routine. In this workshop we will focus on how to get in touch with our provocative, seductive selves and how to move our bodies with confidence. Absolutely no experience necessary and this workshop is open to EVERYONE - all gender identities & sexual orientations welcome! BY DONATION with proceeds going to PRIDE YMM

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Paint Night Out 2022
Summary: Adults are invited to celebrate pride by getting creative and painting the night away! Painters of all skill levels welcome. (18+)

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Yoga! 2022
Summary: Join Brooke as we celebrate all the colours of the rainbow at Exhale Yoga & Barre's annual PRIDE YOGA CLASS! A "Pay What You Can" class with proceeds going toward Pride YMM to help support their initiatives for the LGBTQ2S+ community here in Fort McMurray. This is a beginner-friendly yoga practice for everyone who wants to celebrate Pride. We believe that yoga is for everybody and every BODY, regardless of ethnicity, age, shape, size or ability. Regardless of gender or sexual orientation. This will be a special class inclusive to everyone; Yoga for all! BY DONATION with proceeds going toward PRIDE YMM!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Two Spirit Panel Talk/Two Spirit Identity: Reclaiming our Roles 2022
Summary: A panel discussion amongst Two Spirit people as they share their stories and visions of the future. Join panelists Dustin Dufault, Katalin Loutit and Mitchel Bowers as they share their stories of connecting with their two spirit identities. Learn more about the history of Two Spirits, their traditional roles within Indigenous communities and our visions for the future. This event is free to attend and is located within the recital theatre at Keyano College.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Tie-Dye T-Shirt Contest 2022
Summary: Teens are invited to celebrate pride by competing to make the BEST tie-dye t-shirt! Tie-dye supplies, patches, sequins, and other accessories will be provided. Winner will take home a $25 gift card. (13-17yrs)

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Bingo 2022
Summary: When Drag meets Bingo you better believe you're in for a good time. Come out for a fun evening of dabbing those dabbers, and winning some fabulous prizes.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Drag Paint Night 2022
Summary: Grab your friends and your artistic hat and let paint a starry pride filled night! Taught by Simma Downe and special assistant Ella Lamoureux! We provide everything you need to paint this beautiful landscape, just bring your friends!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride Festival/Pride YMM Festival 2022
Summary: The annual Pride Festival is a family friendly event, to bring together the queer community and our allies. There will be a marketplace, games, and live entertainment.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Pride After Party 2022
Summary: We're putting more party in the Pride After Party. There will be music and dancing all night long with pop-up drag numbers throughout the night. More casual seating, an open dance floor and the gayest music all night long, its everything you need to end Pride Week. Come sporting your best pride attire and enjoy our signature cocktails. Appetizers will also be served throughout the night. Drag Performances by Billi Gold, Ella Lamoureux, Eric Nochurch, Simma Downe & Stella L'Amour

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Trans Day of Remembrance Vigil 2022
Summary: Nov 20 is Transgender Day of Remembrance where we come together to remember all of the lives of transgender people who have come before us. Those taken too soon, those who never got to live their true lives, the activists and all other trans people we’ve lost. We will meet at the Pride YMM offices 9912 Manning Ave and walk to Jubilee Plaza. Dress for the weather.

Title: Pride YMM AGM 2022
Summary: Join us for our first in person AGM Meeting! There will be refreshments provided as well we will be announcing the dates of 2023 Pride!

Title: Pride YMM Fun Fair 2023
Summary: The Annual Pride YMM Fun Fair is back. There will be face painting, carnival games, crafts, snacks, prizes and more! There is fun for the whole family!

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Rainbow Spaces Initiative 2023
Summary: Pride YMM’s Rainbow Spaces initiative promotes and fosters safer and more inclusive spaces, organizations, and businesses for 2SLGBTQIA+ individuals in the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo. Organizations and businesses that have taken specific steps outlined by the initiative receive Rainbow Spaces designation and receive public recognition for their commitment to 2SLGBTQIA+ inclusion.

Title: Fort McMurray Wood Buffalo Inclusivity Workshops 2023
Summary: Pride YMM’s workshops were created to provide awareness and education for individuals, organizations, and businesses seeking to become more informed and inclusive allies. Our workshops provide information on the 2SLGBTQIA+ community, best practices for inclusivity and accessibility, and empowers allies with both empathy and strategies for concrete actions in allyship. We offer 90-minute and 3-hour workshops.

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Society First Logo
Summary: We are proud to show the world our official logo! We'd also like to let you know that we will be releasing Dawson Creek's 2011 Pride Guide by next Monday morning. Stay tuned!

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2011
Summary: It's official! Here's our 2011 Pride Guide! Thank you so much for your patience!

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2012
Summary:
Dawson Creek Pride Society Presents: The Coldest Pride in Canada! and, of course,The Best Party in The Peace!!
Hello everyone,
We hope you have had a great summer! Dawson Creek Pride Society is proud to announce the 7th Annual Dawson Creek Pride on October 27th, 2012 at KPAC.
Our theme this year is MASKerade, so dig out your favorite flashy costume, make a new one, or come in your civvies. Pair it with a funky mask and come out, rock it out and camp it up with special guest star Ivana B’Alone St Asia from Prince George representing the best of drag performance in the north.

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2013
Summary: The 8th annual Pride is coming up on October 26th

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2014
Summary: Featuring a variety show of local performers! Doors open at 7:00pm with the show to start at 7:30pm - dance to follow.

Title: Dawson Creek 10th Annual Pride Guide 2015
Summary: Join us for the 10th annual Pride celebration in Dawson Creek, featuring a variety of local performers! Please note that this is a 14A event, with beverages and snacks for purchase. Costumes are strongly encouraged but not required

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2016
Summary: The Dawson Creek Pride Society proudly presents our 11th annual Hallowe'en show and dance, this year at the beautiful Bear Mountain Ski Hill! Doors at 6pm, show at 7pm, with the dance to start at approximately 8pm.

Title: Dawson Creek Rocky Horror Picture Show Screening 2016
Organization Name: ["Dawson Creek Pride Society","Kiwanis Performing Arts Centre"]
Summary: Be sure to check out this great event coming Pride weekend!

Title: Dawson Creek Post-Pride Brunch 2016
Summary: Come join us for a post-Pride brunch at Browns Social House! There are lots of seats at the table

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2017
Summary: The 12th annual Dawson Creek Pride celebration will be the weekend of October 20th to 22nd! There will be a screening of the Rocky Horror Picture Show on Friday the 20th, our yearly show & dance on Saturday the 21st, and brunch the morning of Sunday the 22nd. More details will be released in the coming weeks!

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2018
Summary:
Dawson Creek Pride Society Presents Dragapalooza!
Saturday, October 27 at Mercer Hall at the Encana Events Centre
Join us for our 13th Annual Pride Celebration! Featuring a Variety Show of Local Performers followed by a dance with music by Shane Holthe, Metatron Entertainment

Title: First Dawson Creek Pride Paint Night
Organization Name: ["Dawson Creek Pride Society","Dawson Creek Art Gallery"]
Summary:
As part of our Open Mind Studios, in partnership with the Dawson Creek Pride Society, The DCAG is excited to hold our first Pride Paint Night.
This is a FREE all ages event, where members of our Lgbtqia2s community can come meet, make art, and enjoy yummy treats!

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Guide 2019
Summary:
Welcome to the sexiest night on earth! Come one, come all to the Night Circus!!
Join in on Dawson Creek's 14th annual Pride celebration! Dress in your wildest and weirdest costumes, and enjoy a night of live, local entertainers followed by a dance by DJ Shane Holthe, Metatron Entertainment.

Title: Dawson Creek Colorful Community Art 2020
Organization Name: ["Dawson Creek Pride Society","Dawson Creek Art Gallery"]
Summary: The DCAG, in partnership with Dawson Creek Pride Society, invites you to attend a streaming art class in celebration of Pride month. We’ll be creating colourful art to promote inclusion, acceptance, and awareness in our community.

Title: Dawson Creek Rainbow Crosswalk Community Photo 2020
Summary: The Dawson Creek Pride Society is proud to be hosting a community photo at the rainbow crosswalk in front of Dawson Creek Secondary School on June 14th.

Title: Dawson Creek Take a Photo On The Crosswalk 2020
Summary:
Did you miss our big community rainbow crosswalk photo? No problem! Take your own picture of yourself on the crosswalk and post it in this event! We will put all the photos together into one extremely prideful slideshow/video for the community to share ❤️🏳️‍🌈
Wear whatever you'd like - rainbow or trans flag colours, a T-Rex costume, dress in drag, or come as you are!

Title: Dawson Creek Pride Society Organizational Changes
Summary:
In this meeting we hope to cover a variety of topics:
- becoming an incorporated BC society
- October Pride celebration
- future events
- building community
- youth subcommittee
